Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Guest Editor of the Special Issue “Mathematical Problems in Engineering” in the international journal “Applied Mathematical Sciences” (indexed in Scopus).
Associate Editor for the international journal “Mathematics in Engineering, Science and Aerospace”.

Associate Editor for the international journal “IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems” (indexed in both ISI and Scopus). According to the ISI Impact Factor 2015, the journal is in the first quartile in ISI according to 4 different subject categories.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Participation at conferences as speaker: •2nd International Workshop on Optimization, Machine Learning and Big Data (MOD 2016), Volterra, Italy, August 26th-29th, 2016 •24th European Symposium on Artificial Neural Networks, Computational Intelligence and Machine Learning (ESANN 2016), Bruges, Belgium, September 27th-29th, 2016 •45th Conference of the Italian Operational Research Society (AIRO 2015), Pisa, Italy, September 7th-10th, 2015 •14th IEEE European Control Conference (IEEE ECC 2015), Linz, Austria, July 15th-17th, 2015 •53rd IEEE International Conference on Decision and Control (IEEE CDC 2014), Los Angeles, CA, USA, December 15th-17th, 2014 •44th Conference of the Italian Operational Research Society (AIRO 2014), Como, Italy, September 2nd-5th, 2014 •20th Conference of the International Federation of Operational Research Societies (IFORS 2014), Barcelona, Spain, July 13rd-18th, 2014 •3rd International Conference on Arts and Technology (ArtsIT 2013), Milan, Italy, March 21st-23rd, 2013 •6th Winter Conference of the Italian Operational Research Society (AIRO Winter 2011), Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy, February 7th-12th, 2011 •24th International Conference of the Association of European Operational Research Societies (EURO 2010), Lisbon, Portugal, July 11th-14th, 2010 •36th International Conference on Current Trends in Theory and Practice of Computer Science (SOFSEM 2010), Špindlerův Mlýn, Czech Republic, January 23rd-29th, 2010 •International Network Optimization Conference (INOC 2009), Pisa, Italy, April 26th-29th, 2009 •40th Conference of the Italian Operational Research Society (AIRO 2009), Siena, Italy, September 8th-11th, 2009 •38th Conference of the Italian Operational Research Society (AIRO 2007), Genoa, Italy, September 5th-8th, 2007

Invited talks: •October 22nd, 2007: invited talk at the Institute of Computer Science - Academy of Science, Prague, Czech Republic •October 7th, 2009: invited talk at the seminar SLIPGURU - DISI, University of Genoa, Italy •February 21st, 2012: invited talk at the seminar “Optimization and Game Theory”, DIMA, University of Genoa, Italy • May 8th, 2012: invited talk at the research center “Casa Paganini - Infomus”, University of Genoa, Italy •December 10th, 2014: invited talk at the third Italian Workshop on Machine Learning and Data Mining, University of Pisa, Italy •May 7th, 2015: invited talk at the Workshop on “Variational Analysis, Game Theory and Related Topics”, University of Genoa, Italy •September 22nd, 2015: invited talk at the fourth Italian Workshop on Machine Learning and Data Mining, University of Ferrara, Italy •February 16th, 2016: invited talk at Scuola Superiore Sant’Anna, Pisa, Italy
2008: Scientific Secretary of the Local Organizing Committee of the 7th Int. Conf. “Mathematical Problems in Engineering, Aerospace, and Sciences” (ICNPAA 2008)

Organization of seminars at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca: •July 18th, 2016; October 14th, 2015; March 2nd, 2015; July 10th, 2014: Vĕra Kůrkova, Institute of Computer Science, Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic •July 18th, 2016; July 10th, 2014: Paul C. Kainen, Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Georgetown University, Washington, USA
Participation at conferences as session chair: •IFORS 2014, Barcelona, Spain, July 13rd -18th, 2014

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Collaboration with the Dept. of Biophysical and Electronic Engineering (DIBE) - University of Genoa (Prof. B. Bianco) on “Definition of optimality criteria for the choice of the parameters for the Cole-Davidson model, and application to a particular case”.

Collaboration with the Dept. of Communications, Computer, and System Sciences (DIST) - University of Genoa (Prof. R. Zoppoli), on “Comparison between linear and nonlinear one-hidden layer approximating networks”.

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Supervisor of the Ph.D. student Mohammed Abdelsamea at IMT - School for Advaced Studies, Lucca. Title of the thesis: “Regional Active Contours Based on Variational Level Sets and Machine Learning for Image Segmentation”. The Ph.D. student Mohammed Abdelsamea was the first in his track to complete the Ph.D. at IMT Lucca in March 2015.

•Academic Year 2013-2014: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “Optimal Control” at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca (20 hours, Ph.D. track in Computer, Decision, and System Science, and Ph.D. track in Economics).

Supervisor of the Ph.D. student Rita Morisi at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca. Title of the thesis: “Graph-based Techniques and Spectral Graph Theory in Control and Machine Learning”). The Ph.D. student Rita Morisi was among the first in her track to complete the Ph.D. in July 2016.
•2014: Ph.D. (Mathematics) thesis committee member at UniRomaTre. Student: Danilo Costarelli. Title of the thesis: “Sigmoidal Functions Approximation and Applications”.

•Academic Year 2014-2015: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “Optimal Control” at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca (20 hours, Ph.D. tracks in: Computer Science, Control Systems, Image Analysis, Management Science, Economics, Computational Mechanics, Complex Networks).
•Academic Year 2014-2015: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “An Introduction do Dynamic Optimization and Optimal Control: Models, Solutions, and Approximations” at the University of Genoa (20 hours).

•Academic Year 2015-2016: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “Optimal Control” at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca (20 hours + 10 hours of review of Linear Algebra, Ph.D. tracks in: Computer Science and System Engineering and Economics, Management and Data Science).
•Academic Year 2015-2016: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “An Introduction do Dynamic Optimization and Optimal Control: Models, Solutions, and Approximations” at the University of Genoa.

•Academic Year 2016-2017: 2-hours lecture (October 10th, 2016) at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca on “LASSO estimation” within the Ph.D. Course “Analytics and Data Science in Economics and Management, II” held by Prof. Massimo Riccaboni (Ph.D. track in Economics, Management and Data Science).
•Academic Year 2016-2017: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “Matrix Algebra” at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca (10 hours, Ph.D. track in Economics, Management and Data Science).

•Academic Year 2016-2017: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “Optimal Control” at IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca (20 hours, Ph.D. tracks in: Computer Science and System Engineering and Economics, Management and Data Science).
Co-advisor of a Master’s Degree thesis in Mathematics (topic: game theory) at the University of Genoa (student: Alessio Cirimele)
Reviewer of a Ph.D. thesis in Information Engineering and Science (topic: machine learning) at the University of Siena. Student: Alessandro Rossi.
•Academic Year 2016-2017: teacher of the Ph.D. Course “An Introduction do Dynamic Optimization and Optimal Control: Models, Solutions, and Approximations” at the University of Genoa.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Visiting scientist at the Institute of Computer Science of the Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic, Prague (joint research with Prof. Vĕra Kůrková on machine learning and neural networks).
Visiting scientist at the University of Cambridge, UK (joint research with Prof. Béla Bollobás on percolation applied to telecommunications networks).

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: “Laurea Quinquennale” (Master's Degree) in Telecommunications Engineering (2004, University of Genoa, 110/110 cum Laude). Thesis: “Application of Support Vector Machines to Optimal Control Problems”. Supervisors: Proff. Marcello Sanguineti and Riccardo Zoppoli. Average examination mark before the thesis defense: about 29.54/30.
Member of the NOCC laboratory (Nonlinear Optimization, Complexity, and Control Laboratory) at DIST - University of Genoa.

Master's degree level teaching at the University of Genoa: •Academic Year 2012-13: assistant lecturer and exerciser within the Courses: - Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Logistics and Transportation Engineering); - Business Management and Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Electronic Engineering); - Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Informatics Engineering); - Operations Research 1 (“Laurea Triennale” in Management Engineering - Savona, University Campus). •Academic Year 2011-12: assistant lecturer and exerciser (10 hours) within the Course of Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Logistics and Transportation Engineering. •Academic Year 2011-12: contract Assistant Professor (40 hours) within the Courses: -Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Informatics Engineering); -Business Management and Operations Research “(Laurea Magistrale” in Electronic Engineering). •Academic Year 2010-11: contract Assistant Professor (30 hours) within the Course of Mathematical Methods, Statistics, and Operations Research (“Laurea Magistrale” in Logistics and Transportation Engineering). •Academic Year 2007-08: contract Assistant Professor (30 hours) within the Course of Operations Research 1 (“Laurea” in Electronic Engineering). •Academic Year 2006-07: contract Assistant Professor (30 hours; art. 33 Statuto University of Genoa) within the Course of Operations Research 1 (“Laurea” in Civil and Environmental Engineering). •Academic Year 2006-07: contract Assistant Professor (30 hours; art. 33 Statuto University of Genoa) within the Course of Operations Research 1 (“Laurea” in Electronic Engineering). •Since 2007: qualified expert (“Cultore della Materia”) in Operations Research, within the “Laurea” courses in Logistics and Transportation Engineering, Informatics Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering, and Management Engineering. •2005-06: contract for the drafting of the lecture notes for the Course of Operations Research 1 (“Laurea” in Electronic Engineering).

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Member of the “Progetto di Ateneo 2006” of the University of Genoa “Application of the extended Ritz method to control problems”. Coordinator: Prof. Marco Baglietto.

Member of the Italian Research Program of National Interest (PRIN - MIUR) “Models and algorithms for robust network optimization”. National coordinator: Prof. Matteo Fischetti. Research unit coordinator: Prof. Paola Zuddas.

Member of the international project 2004-2009 “Learning from data by neural networks and kernel methods: An approach based on approximate optimization” (originally a 2004-2006 project, then renewed for the years 2007-2009), among University of Genoa, National Research Council of Italy, and Czech Academy of Sciences. Italian coordinator: Prof. Marcello Sanguineti. Czech coordinator: Prof. Vĕra Kůrkova.

Member of the “Progetto di Ateneo 2008” of the University di Genoa “Solving functional optimization problems through nonlinear approximators and learning from data”. Coordinator: Prof. Marcello Sanguineti.

Member of the Italian Research Program of National Interest (PRIN-MIUR) “Adaptive state estimation and adaptive optimal control”. National coordinator: Prof. Giorgio Picci. Research unit coordinator: Prof. Riccardo Zoppoli.

Member of the international project 2010-2012 “Complexity of neural-network and kernel computational models”, among University of Genoa, National Research Council of Italy, and Czech Academy of Sciences. Italian coordinator: Prof. Marcello Sanguineti. Czech coordinator: Prof. Vĕra Kůrkova.

Member of the DIBRIS research staff (University of Genoa) in the EU project 7FP ICT FET SIEMPRE (Social Interaction and Entrainment using Music PeRformancE: www.siempre.infomus.org). Coordinator: Prof. Antonio Camurri. In the project, I contributed in the investigation of techniques for the automated analysis of nonverbal social signals in groups of people. I also applied my competencies in music (I have two 10-years "Conservatorio" diplomas in violin and viola, respectively), combining them with methods of Operations Research (e.g., Game Theory).

Member of the research project “Methodologies for the approximate solution of team optimization problems and strategic interaction problems”, granted by INdAM-GNAMPA (Italian Institute for High Mathematics, Group for Mathematical Analysis, Probability, and their Applications). Coordinator: Prof. Marcello Sanguineti.
Member of the EU project 2012-2015H2020 IC EFFINET (Efficient Integrated Real-time Monitoring and Control of Drinking Water Networks: effinet.eu). Italian Coordinator: Prof. Alberto Bemporad.
Director of the Research Unit of INdAM (National Institute for Advanced Mathematics) at the IMT - School for Advanced Studies, Lucca.
Member of the H2020-ICT-2015 project TELMI (Technology enhanced learning of musical instrument performance). Italian Coordinator: Prof. Gualtiero Volpe.
